'''DC Studios''' is an American film and television production company. A subsidiary of [[Warner Bros. Pictures]], it specializes in adaptations of characters published by {{w|DC Comics}}, such as {{w|Superman}}, {{w|Batman}}, {{w|Wonder Woman}}, {{w|The Flash}}, {{W|Green Lantern}}, {{w|Aquaman}}, and {{W|Martian Manhunter}}.

== Featured franchises ==

=== Batman ===
[[File:Jim Lee's Batman.png|thumb|width=318x318|Batman as illustrated on the cover of [https://dc.fandom.com/wiki/Batman_Vol_1_608 Batman Vol 1 No. 608].]]
Created by {{Wikipedia|Bill Finger}} and {{Wikipedia|Bob Kane}}, Batman is the secret identity of philanthropist Bruce Wayne. Following the death of his parents as a child, he traveled the world looking for strength, and returned to his hometown of {{Wikipedia|Gotham City}} becoming a masked superhero. Through his many adventures he has made many enemies, most notably his archenemy {{Wikipedia|Joker (character)|the Joker}} and crime boss {{Wikipedia|Penguin (character)|the Penguin}}. Among his allies include {{Wikipedia|Robin (character)|Robin}}, a title shared by many of Bruce's sidekicks, the first of which becoming a hero in his own right, {{Wikipedia|Nightwing}}.
{{-}}

=== Superman ===
[[File:Jim Lee's Superman.png|thumb|width=318x318|Superman as illustrated on the cover of [https://dc.fandom.com/wiki/Superman_Vol_2_204 Superman Vol 2 No. 204].]]Created by {{Wikipedia|Jerry Siegel}} and {{Wikipedia|Joe Shuster}}, Superman is the secret identity of mild mannered reporter Clark Kent. Born on the planet of {{Wikipedia|Krypton (comics)|Krypton}} to a pair of scientists, he became the sole survivor of its destruction, raised by a kind couple in {{Wikipedia|Smallville (comics)|Smallville}}. As an adult he became employed by the {{Wikipedia|Daily Planet}}, falling in love with reporter {{Wikipedia|Lois Lane}} and befriending the young photographer {{Wikipedia|Jimmy Olsen}}. Among his enemies include his nemesis {{Wikipedia|Lex Luthor}}, a bald billionaire who sees Superman as an existential threat against humanity. 

In 2025, the film franchise would be rebooted under filmmaker {{Wikipedia|James Gunn}}, previously known for his work on the [[Guardians of the Galaxy]] film series. This film, simply titled {{Wikipedia|Superman (2025 film)|Superman}}, serves as the first installment of the {{Wikipedia|DC Universe (franchise)|DC Universe}} shared universe, following the adventures of a Superman three years into his career. Throughout the film he's entrusted to look over his {{w|Supergirl|cousin}}'s dog, {{w|Krypto}}, and helps take down an international conspiracy with the help of the Justice Gang, made up of {{w|Guy Gardner (character)|Green Lantern}}, {{w|Mister Terrific (Michael Holt)|Mr. Terrific}}, and {{w|Hawkgirl (Kendra Saunders)|Hawkgirl}}.

=== Wonder Woman ===
[[File:Jim Lee's Wonder Woman.png|thumb|width=318x318|Wonder Woman as illustrated on a cover of [https://dc.fandom.com/wiki/Wonder_Woman_Vol_6_1 Wonder Woman Vol 6 No. 1].]]Created by {{Wikipedia|William Moulton Marston}} and {{Wikipedia|H. G. Peter}}, Wonder Woman is the secret identity of Diana Prince. Born from clay on the paradise island of {{Wikipedia|Themyscira_(DC_Comics)|Themyscira}}, she was raised by her mother {{Wikipedia|Hippolyta (DC Comics)|Hippolyta}} isolated from the rest of Earth. A chance encounter with airman {{Wikipedia|Steve Trevor}} leads her to leave her home, wielding mystical weapons such as her {{Wikipedia|Lasso of Truth}}, {{Wikipedia|Wonder Woman's bracelets|Bracelets of Submission}}, and {{Wikipedia|Invisible Jet}}.{{-}}

=== Superman ===
To promote the release of the 2025 {{Wikipedia|Superman (2025 film)|Superman}} film, two DLCs were released on the [[Marketplace]]. The first, the [[Superman Skin Pack]], was released on July 8, 2025. A [[Superman DLC|map]] would follow it, featuring several scenarios adapted from the film.

== Trivia ==

* When the film ''{{Wikipedia|Aquaman and the Lost Kingdom}}'' was released, special artwork of [[Jason Momoa]]'s Aquaman was released;<ref>{{Cite Instagram|minecraft|C1LF1Opvl0O|Congratulations on the release of your new movie this week Jason Momoa / @prideofgypsies<br><br>We want more Momoa! ðŸ‘€|December 22, 2023}}</ref> Momoa was announced to be starring as {{AMCM|Garrett}} in {{AMCM}} by this time.<ref>{{Cite|url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/movies/movie-news/minecraft-movie-jason-momoa-1235131605/|title=Jason Momoa to Star in 'Minecraft' Movie for Warner Bros.|author=Aaron Couch|website=The Hollywood Reporter|date=18 April 2022}}</ref>
** Similarly, in a behind the scenes video for the film, Momoa holds a prop [[trident]], referencing his pervious role.
* In the official ''Minecraft'' game [[Doki Doki Compatibility Quest: 3]], the player can optionally mention being a Batman fan.
* During an episode of [[Overworld Adventures]], [[Sofia Dankis]] equates herself to Superman.<ref name="best">{{mcnet|overworld-adventures-chapter-3|Simply the Best|May 12, 2025|Sofia Dankis}}</ref>
* The design of the [[MC Experience Cape]] was inspired by the Batman villain {{Wikipedia|Two-Face}}.<ref>{{ytl|t3VeWcl9S4g|7 Hidden Easter Eggs in NEW Minecraft Experience!|Rays Works|October 20, 2024}}</ref>
* To promote the release of the Batman DLC, a build challenge was held on [[Minecraft.net]].<ref>{{Mcnet|build-challenge--batman|Build Challenge: Batman|December 12, 2022|[[Lindsey Schaal]]}}</ref> 
** Batman has been joked about in several other articles.<ref>{{Mcnet|new-java-realms-the-realms-travel-agency|New on Java Realms: The Realms Travel Agency|June 18, 2021|[[Oskar Thysell]]}}</ref><ref>{{Mcnet|hay-bale|Block of the Month: Hay Bale|July 29, 2024|[[Duncan Geere]]}}</ref>
* One of the actors known for playing Batman, [[Will Arnett]], was a cohost of [[MINECON Earth 2017]]. This fact was joked about several times during the show.<ref>{{Mcnet|will-arnett-hosting-minecon-earth|Will Arnett is hosting MINECON Earth!|October 19, 2017|[[Tom Stone]]}}</ref>
* Within the [[Dark Horse Comics]] series, the protagonist [[Tyler]] is shown to be a fan of comic book character "Catman." Although the name is an overt reference to Batman, artwork of the character resembles an anthropomorphic cat in ripped shorts.
